meanings.definition: trachles (verb): to struggle or have difficulty with something
meanings.sent1: She trachles with her math homework every night.
meanings.sent2: The hiker trachles up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The kitten trachles to catch the elusive laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His mind trachles through the complex problem like a maze.
meanings.sent5: The old car trachles along the bumpy road, barely moving forward.

meanings.definition: trachles (noun): a difficult or challenging situation
meanings.sent1: Facing a trachles at work, she remained calm and focused.
meanings.sent2: The team overcame the trachles of the final round and won the championship.
meanings.sent3: The trachles of planning a surprise party for her best friend made her nervous.
meanings.sent4: In the trachles of life, she found strength she never knew she had.
meanings.sent5: The trachles of the escape room kept them entertained for hours.
